wordpressPost.title: How to have good intestinal health
wordpressPost.content:
How to have good intestinal health

 

Every morning I wake up and put kale, spinach, beets, organic blueberries, raspberries, almond milk, cinnamon, turmeric, cayenne pepper, lemon, and two probiotics into a blender and make what I think is a pretty tasty gut cleanser.

Could I add even more goodies to make it even more healthy? Â Absolutely but, the important thing here is consistency.

I not only feel great knowing that for breakfast I’ve already consumed half of my daily fruits and veggies but, I physically feel energized, my hair has started to grow again and, my skin is looking pretty good too.

How to have good intestinal health? The way to maintain your gut or your intestinal health is to do the following:

  • Eliminate sugar as much as possible.
  • Eat raw, fresh and unprocessed food.
  • Chew your food well.
  • Eat two low glycemic fruits each day.
  • Eat at least six vegetables per day (preferably raw).
  • Try and include sprouts in your diet.
  • Vary your foods each day from meal to meal. Â Don’t always eat the same things each day.
  • Eat your biggest meal at lunch and don’t ever go to be with food in your belly.
  • Drink at least 64 ounces of filtered water per day.
  • It’s better to drink fluids before and after your meals so that, your digestive fluids are not diluted.
  • Avoid things like coffee, black tea, soda, chocolate, nicotine and alcohol (I’m going to work on the last one! I love my wine).
  • Take probiotics each day.
  • Move your body.

I don’t think the things above are hard to do. Â If you follow the steps above, you will most likely feel pretty good too.

They say that most if not all disease start in the gut. Â If this is true then, doing the steps above should cut your risk significantly.
